answers.answer: Have you been checked for hypoglycemia or another diabetic disease?  My friend had that problem in the morning when her blood sugar was too low.....since has been corrected with diet and medication.

I have been tested for diabetes and it was negative.  I have also had four miscarriages which my doctors have found no cause for.  They have all been early, 6-8 weeks along and I have miscarried.  I have told both my regular doctor and my fertility specialist about the faiting spells.  They have both said that it could be symptoms of PCOS.  Sometimes I wonder if the faiting spells and the miscarriages are related, but have never been given any indication of that from the doctors.  And there has never been any treatment offered for the fainting.
does anyone know what might be going on? or ever heard of this?

Fainting, passing out is called, "Syncope"http://www.clevelandclinic.org/heartcenter/pub/guide/disease/electric/syncope.htmWhy this is happening, if of course, the question.I would invest in a blood pressure monitor (been told that Omron is amongst the best) and I myself have one.It would be good to record your blood pressure throughout the day and present this to your doctor.Best,~Kate

Have you seen a neurologist? Are you under a lot of stress? When my friend was working a lot, like all day long and was very stressedhe had often fainting episodes. SHe went to see a neurologist but they sent her to a psychiatrist.-------------EllenG.Steadyhealth.com

I am not stressed and these brief fainting episodes started when I was in high school and have contined, I am now 32 years old.  The weird thing is I don't feel them coming on and they seem to happen more in the mornings and on days when I don't get enough sleep.  I don't stay passed out, I just seem to loose it for a brief second, often dropping things or completely falling down.  It is very scary, especially when I have done it several times in the shower.
did your physicians check for dysautonomia?decreased blood flow ,could cause your misscarriages.there was a case on mystery diagnosis.God bless,Donna

question: I pass out from time to time. it seems like in the mornings, and it's very quick. like I might drop a piece of toast, doctors can not find out what is going on. it's not all the time either, it comes in spurts.
title: PASSING OUT
